solution_line_template: Mara spent ${cost_bumper_car} x {mara_rides_bumper_car} = $<<{cost_bumper_car}*{mara_rides_bumper_car}={mara_bumper_car_cost}>>{mara_bumper_car_cost} for riding the bumper car two times.

Riley spent ${cost_space_shuttle} x {riley_rides_space_shuttle} = $<<{cost_space_shuttle}*{riley_rides_space_shuttle}={riley_space_shuttle_cost}>>{riley_space_shuttle_cost} for riding the space shuttle {riley_rides_space_shuttle} times.

They spent ${cost_ferris_wheel} x {rides_ferris_wheel_each} = $<<{cost_ferris_wheel}*{rides_ferris_wheel_each}={cost_ferris_wheel_per_person}>>{cost_ferris_wheel_per_person} each riding the Ferris wheel {rides_ferris_wheel_each} times.
So, they spent a total of ${cost_ferris_wheel_per_person} x {num_people}= $<<{cost_ferris_wheel_per_person}*{num_people}={total_ferris_wheel_cost}>>{total_ferris_wheel_cost} riding the Ferris wheel.

Therefore the total amount they spent at the carnival is ${mara_bumper_car_cost} + ${riley_space_shuttle_cost} + ${total_ferris_wheel_cost} = $<<{mara_bumper_car_cost}+{riley_space_shuttle_cost}+{total_ferris_wheel_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
